reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun way to learn history
reviews.reviewText: This is a great book to get older kids/teens interested in history.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thank you, AGAIN, Nathan Hale for bringing the joy of reading to my son!
reviews.reviewText: My ten year old has been looking forward to Nathan Hale's latest book for months. We were so excited to have "Lafayette" delivered on the release date. My son read it cover-to-cover in one long sitting. It was blissful to have a night of family reading time, and not even a hint of asking for screen time. Each book in the Hazardous Tales series has enthralled my son. I give these books to parents of his friends that are trying to find the right "hook" to get their kids to enjoy reading. My kid is a history buff and these books really speak to his interest. If anyone can recommend other series of a similar vein, I'm all ears! In the meantime, this will be read over and over again, and we will not-so-patiently await Nathan Hale's next project!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2018
reviews.reviewText: I love this series and I really loved this installment! I'm typically not really into Revolutionary War stories because it was a war that meant freedom for some and not others, but I enjoyed this one because Lafayette was such a dynamic and fun character, truly an adventure and battle seeker. And it felt like this was one of the more understandable story arcs, not confusing at all. Though I do think the author could be better about tracking dates throughout, or making sure there's a recent date marker if a year is randomly mentioned in the narrative. Also, it's cool to see the artwork get better and tighter as the series goes on. Looking forward to learning what the next book topic will be.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a great story, my son and I really enjoyed this tale
reviews.reviewText: Great story and ties into most important and interesting parts of the revolution

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another awesome Hazardous Tale
reviews.reviewText: My kids and I have been hooked on these that we have had the library copies continuously checked out and decided we should probably buy copies of our own. This graphic novel covers Lafayette's early life through the end of the American Revolutionary War. My favorite effect of a Hazardous Tale is that it gets my 7 and 9 year old interested in learning more about the subjects Mr. Hales covers. They went and looked up the rest of Lafayette's amazing life story after the American Revolution. I hope that part of the his tale can be told by Mr. Hale in the future. Can't wait for more!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For Hamilton Fans
reviews.reviewText: My 10 year old isn’t a voracious reader at all. As a teacher, I know how important it is to get his eyes on print as much as possible. He is a Hamilton fan and was excited to dive into this book. He finishes quickly and is interested in more from this series also.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2018
reviews.reviewText: It was as funny and snarky as Nathan Hale's books usually are, but Ethan Allen was in for one of two panels in the long awaited Benedict Arnold backstory,and he was portrayed as a bufoonish egotistical drunkard again, which is out of character. For more information,look up Ethan Allen, and you will learn tons of interesting facts K three to scratch the surface of in this, but I accidentally deleted it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for young Historians.
reviews.reviewText: This book is about the adventures of Lafayette. It is a mix of the American Revolution and Lafayette’s life. Read it. You won’t regret it.
Arrivato in tempo e in condizioni impeccabili. Inutile specificare che il contenuto riassume perfettamente ciò che deve, in chiave, però, ironica e leggera. Davvero molto soddisfatta.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 5, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Excellent. It was a great gift for my husband, he really enjoyed it, especially having seen Hamilton.
The book arrived in a few days in good conditions. Funny, easy to read and paticularly suitable for middle schoolers.
